content.label: In this narrative game you will learn to love squares with different abilities in this charming story. Even though they are just squares, you will relate to each square individually.
An innovative platformer. I played this game on the train everyday on my way to work

title.label: Shapes that are anything but basic

content.label: The simple style mixed with beautiful narration and music, equally make a piece of art worth experiencing

This game was such a delight a few years ago, I decided to revisit it!  Much to my chagrin, it has not been updated for larger screens, and so the game play is a bit off!

Would love to give this a run through again, could you update it for larger, full screen devices??
Just play it. You won’t regret it.
It’s so peaceful and still has mad moments, I think the jump button should be a bit bigger, that’s just me...
I was playing and they said who the h word am I. Totally inappropriate. Only let kids play if you are okay with them hearing curse words. Otherwise good app

title.label: The app doesn’t look suitable for iphone xr

content.label: Just launched the game and it looks like an old app that doesn’t work for new phones, the nig screen in the iphone xr turns obsolete since the app uses like just 2/3 of the whole screen

Basically super Mario with narration. Well narrated but simple game. Unfortunately the controls are not very good on iPhone as if you barely slip off the exact control you’ll stop moving and fall to your death. For such simple graphics you would thing they would have perfected the control issues. Make the input buttons larger man. Not worth the money to buy it. It should be free or only 1.00$ once you fix your inputs. Good try tho.

title.label: Very good just needs a update for newer iPhones

content.label: The screen size needs to updated. I’m not giving lower stars bc it’s still playable and very nice. Worth the money. It’s on sale for discounted price today. It’s 12/20/2019 so pick it up you won’t be disappointed. Nice story, plus I can see care and time was devoted by the developers that’s always nice. I’ll definitely support these guys hope to see new games from them. 😍

I know I’m a little late to the party but I wanted to know if you were gonna update the game to work for the iPhone XR the screen looks a little weird like it can’t fit everything in it and some stuff looks cropped out if you would fix it I would greatly appreciate it
This could be such a great game, but it becomes impossible to jump at times.. it’s like a wall comes up and you can’t jump?! Then one out of the 100 attempts you can? It ruins the game sadly.

I used to love this game and I wanted to play it again, but the controls make it impossible to play. I'll try to jump and it's like Thomas sticks and hits an invisible wall. It's too frustrating to play if you can't play it properly. I'm sad, this game is great with functioning controls. :( Also, screen formatting is super weird on the iPhone X, but I can't find any way to change it.

Wow! I want it on all devices now! The game is great because the quality is very good and the levels and the story are well made!

And I can’t believe it took only 3 people to make this AMAZING game!

I’m a big fan of Thomas Was Alone!

This is one of the best games that I’ve played in a while. I love the minimalist graphics and narration; I think that this game speaks to the storytelling capabilities of games. This game is definitely worth more than the $5 it costs.

I love this game, and it’s certainly my favorite mobile game. People usually play addictive and mindless games that really have no point, but this is a beautiful concept and all the characters have unique and interesting personalities.
I remember when I was young I would watch my sisters play this game, back when it was available in the PS3 Store. They never did get that far, and since it was a very long time ago and since it was available as a mobile game I decided I would buy it. It was worth the money and worth much, much more. It’s entertaining, beautiful, and such a nice game. The narration is so peaceful and the music is amazing. It just comes to show that you don’t need the best graphics if you have a story to tell, and oh boy does this game have a story. 10 out of 10 and I implore everyone to play this game.

title.label: Controls just not awesome on iPhone XR

content.label:
Felt like I could barely jump or do any platforming.

Story was not great. Did not make it to the later levels. Was bored. Don’t let me sway your opinion tho... this was “editors choice”

title.label: I never thought I’d care for shapes so much!

content.label: What makes this simple platformer so engaging is its ongoing story. This seems like just a basic game of squares, but it’s so much more than that. As the player advances through each level, more of the story is revealed to them. A story of these squares, with individual names, personalities and thoughts. As the story progresses and these simple characters experience more of it, we begin to really feel for these characters and start to love them. Thomas Was Alone is such a mind blowing experience with more character development than most AAA games today!
It was worth it all the trouble talking with my grandma about my Apple ID and trying to download the game from my laptop to my phone
By far the best game on the App Store yet. Would love a third story though.
I really liked this game because of the personification of the characters. I was sad for Benjamin though. I like how the backstory was told also. Great game!
So simple, yet so wonderful!

title.label: Great game, ignore the review about bad controls

content.label: This is a great game.  Precise controls, good story and audio, great aesthetic.  Ignore the featured review that is 3 stars.

The would be a bit interesting and better if the controls were easier to handle. It seems like trying to switch characters on one side of the screen can be impossible sometimes as well as moving doesn’t always recognize touch. This happens on multiple devices and a friend of mine also has this issue. Not worth the 5 dollars as it is now.

The storyline is incredible! I can’t explain how one little game can make you so attached to different...colored... ‘boxes’. I just know I wept over the characters. I have played this game more times than I can count, it is one of my true favorites.

title.label: My view of the app, IT IS SOOO GOOD!!!

content.label:
I have really good problem solving skills and this was no problem for me. It was the right amount of easy for me. Even though Benjamins flight can be hard, I went through it with no doubt. THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER AND I’M CRAVING MORE OF THIS I LOVE IT SO MUCHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!
If you don’t really know if you want to buy it, you have to have good problem solving skills and have really good handling of the controls, not a lot of people get it.....
BUT IF YOU DON’T CARE, THEN BUY IT!!!! IT IS THE BEST GAME EVER!!!!!!!!

Used to play this on an old iPad. However is there a way to get full screen support for the iPhone X???
Amazing game btw
Thomas is great on Sundays Mondays Tuesdays and poosdays💩👨🏽‍🎤👶🏿👨🏿‍🔬🕵🏿‍♀️👨🏻‍🏭
Hours of fun with 100 levels to play. Really enjoyed this game.
Accidentally bought the app as I was trying to update the apps I have on my phone via finger print. Got charged $4.99 for it and I am so sad I do not like the app.. so much to get my money refunded.
I downloaded this game quite a while back. Loved it then and it continues to be an all time favorite.

Since I am only in the beginning stages of the game this is only my initial reaction. I enjoy the simple design, the story and the narration (Not being British, I love the British accent of the narrator!)

But, there are some things that could be improved to make it even better. First, optimize for the iPhone X screen. Second, make the control areas larger, especially the left-right movement buttons. Finally, while there is a “stretch” when Thomas jumps, there is no “squish” (or compression) when he lands, or bumps into a wall. That additional subtle animation trick would make the character feel more real and more fun to control.

Hear me out if you can drop a couple dollars for this game it’s really nice to. Great story and it’s marvelously impressive how much character the creators can imbue with just a narrator and his one voice. Great story paired with satisfyingly difficult platforming. Different strength of each character makes it hard to figure out a plan and executing the plan is hard but fun.

I love this game because of all the different colors. First of all, the quadrilaterals are different colors. In fact, I like all the superpowers they have. For example, super jump would be my super power. In conclusion, The colors are so lovely.

The controller support for this game is so bad I can't even begin to lost how many bugs it has

And this on an already very control and input timing dependent game.

On my 4th play through. I love this game the music the narration and fun puzzle platforming game play makes for a great game to get sucked into while sitting on the couch. Please buy this game give it a chance you won’t be disappointed

title.label: Why is this wonderful game not rated updated for IOS 11???

content.label: This game is truly remarkable.
One of the best iOS games written. Story and narration is world class. Enjoyable for adults and kids alike.
Totally unnecessary to have profanity and crudeness. Too bad that I didn't catch that part of the review, before purchase. Storyline sketchy.

title.label: Please update to save this gem!

content.label: So sad that this hasn't been updated to support 64 bit. Please update and save it. Such a great game.
Lovely game, lovely interface. I'm not usually a gamer, and I'm very picky. But I do love this game. It's taken me awhile to get somewhere too. Just the right amount of challenging. I love it. :)

To the developer(s) you've created a really fun and challenging platformer, however I love playing this game when time allows for it and would hate to see it go because it isn't supported on newer generation devices.
Totally awesome!
This app need 64 bit support update please
Great game but would not buy going forward as this app is marked as not being compatible with future iOS version coming out in fall of 2017

I had heard things about this game. I heard it was great. So when I realized I could get this on my iPhone, I was overjoyed. So now here I am. Beaten all the levels. Collected all the collectibles. And I still play it though. It might not be great in gameplay or graphics. But what does it strive in? Storytelling. The story is dang amazing! One of the best stories yet! And that's saying something because I've played Undertale. It's also really dang emotional! Yet again, because I've played Undertale. I felt like I was stabbed with a dagger in the chest after playing chapter 4. (You'll know what I mean once you play the game) I really would call this 11/10. No, 15/10! The only thing I can complain about is the price. I think $1 would be a better price as the game goes by fast. But overall it's a really great game. 15/10
This game is simple, yet completely satisfying! The music and narration make it a must play.
Okay, it's not the hardest puzzle game for a 27-year-old, but it says it was made for young kids, so I think it's good for them. And the story is lovely. I enjoyed the voice acting.
Game is still awesome even after a couple years in the shelf. Well done.

This is one of the best iOS indie games I've ever played. It's wonderfully simple and the narration gives these little squares and rectangle human personalities. The levels are never repetitive and the difficulty is perfectly balance for each level
